intro: Siderodendron floribundum, commonly known as the clustered ironwood, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its dense, woody structure and showy, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in humid, shaded environments and has dark green, glossy leaves. Its flowers are often pink or purple and bloom in clusters, attracting various pollinators. Siderodendron floribundum is valued for its ornamental appeal and has limited use in traditional medicine.
